column5: I have been considering purchasing some of the Bait Gloves from Rod Glove, but some of my research says these items have issues with the red bleeding into soft plastics.   I was curious if anyone has experience positive or negative with this product.    Thanks for any information,  Steve
I've been using them this icefishing season and haven't noticed any bleeding on my white tubes or white swim baits.  Colin
No worries what so ever with bleeding red.

So I looked into them after seeing this and I ended up buying a pair!  Nothing like opening your sleigh after a bumpy sled ride and finding that one treble sunken deep into everything it possibly can...
Thank god they invented them!!!! Don't know how I would have fished another 40 years without them!!!! Rod Glove, My HEROS!!!!!!!
Another option is the bait protectors from Rapala. I have a bunch of these ones and, although they are smaller, they do work fine also.

Thank god they invented them!!!! Don't know how I would have fished another 40 years without them!!!! Rod Glove, My HEROS!!!!!!!    LMAO   Just got off Shift--stand by............. Moxie ..............     OK --you gotz--spelling intentional--the NEW SPY Rod and Reel Combo yet?   If you colour match it with the new ROD gloves--fashionable and -devastatingly  effective  !  You may catch FISH ON   Safe is always a sound concept  The solo Characters out THERE ?]    Can purchase WF @ LOb LAWS as i understand it  Happy Valentimes Day All  ID1
